subject: Master the Skill of Assertive Communication
body:
Assertive Communication: Say It With Backbone... Not Bite
 
Live Webinar
: May 14, 2025 | 60 minutes
CE Credits
: HRCI: 1, SHRM: 1
Speaking up shouldn’t feel like a confrontation.
Assertive communication allows you to express yourself clearly, respectfully, and confidently—without being aggressive or passive. It’s a crucial skill for building stronger relationships, setting boundaries, and navigating tough conversations at work.
In this webinar, you’ll discover how to use assertiveness to get your point across while earning respect
.
Whether you’re dealing with difficult coworkers, unclear expectations, or high-stakes conversations, you’ll gain tools that help you remain calm, confident, and in control of your message. You’ll walk away with strategies you can put into practice immediately.
Register early and use code 
EARLYBIRD
 to save 20
Secure your spot and strengthen your voice. →
Your Benefits for Attending:
 
Understand what assertiveness really means—and what it doesn’t
Learn how to speak up without sounding aggressive
Get strategies for handling passive-aggressive coworkers
Gain confidence in saying “no” without guilt
Improve your presence and influence with leadership
Communication affects every part of your day—from email tone to live conversations. If you’ve ever struggled to find the right balance between staying quiet and coming on too strong, this session will give you the confidence and skills to be both firm and respectful in any situation.
Communicate clearly, confidently, and professionally. →

The #1 Competitive Moat in 2025? The Ability to Adapt
Four areas where agility can give you an edge.
Connor Reece
Apr 3
 
READ IN APP
 
Most business leaders have heard the wisdom that the best moats are built once.
Build a great product.
Build a great brand.
Build a loyal customer base.
Build strong margins through systems and scale.
And sure—those things still matter.
But in 2025?
The game has changed.
The strongest moat isn’t something we build once. It’s the ability to adapt again and again.
A Real-World Wake-Up Call
Think about how quickly the landscape is shifting.
AI tools are advancing weekly...
Cyber threats are evolving daily...
And customer expectations are constantly changing.
However? 
Many businesses are still trying to win using playbooks from five years ago.
The companies that are thriving? 
They aren’t the ones with the best legacy systems.
They’re the ones who can spin up new systems fast.
The ones who can try new channels, test new offers, pivot messaging, switch vendors, and adjust their operations with minimal drag.
Adaptability isn’t a bonus anymore.
It’s the moat.
4 Areas Where Adaptability Will Set You Apart
1. Technology
It’s not about buying the most software—it’s about managing it well.
Are we locked into rigid systems that make it hard to pivot?
Or are we flexible enough to integrate new tools, adjust workflows, and build automations quickly?
The best tech stack is the one that can evolve with a team—not the one that boxes you in.
2. Customers
Is our sales engine built for one type of buyer?
Or can we experiment with new segments, verticals, and acquisition channels?
Winning companies don’t just have a strong customer list...
They have the capability to go get the next one.
3. Operations
If demand spiked tomorrow, could our team handle it?
If it dropped, could we scale down without chaos?
Operational flexibility is a core advantage—and it comes from clear processes, modular systems, and the right mix of internal + outsourced capabilities.
4. People
Do we have a team of specialists with narrow job descriptions?
Or cross-functional thinkers who can learn, adjust, and solve problems?
Resilience lives in our people...
And if a team is change-averse, the entire business is at risk.
A Quick Gut Check
Ask your team these questions:
"If our biggest customer left tomorrow, what would we do?"
"If a competitor slashed prices by 50%, how fast could we respond?"
"If a major system failed, do we have a plan—or just hope?"
If the answers feel shaky…
It’s a sign you’re relying on old moats.
Final Thought
The next wave of winners won’t just have great products, loyal customers, or killer tech.
They’ll have something more rare:
The ability to move fast. To rethink. To adapt.
Don’t just defend your ground.
Build the capability to move.

Slightly frugal. Still fun. 
Oh hey - glad we caught you before summer sets in and starts clouding your judgment. We know it’s tempting to shell everything out next season… but post-splurge regret is real. Try these tips to keep your spending straight. 
Summer responsibly 
 
Follow these steps. 👣 
•
Tip 1: Kick it in the Caribbean. 
Island hopping’s always a good idea - especially now. Caribbean flights are the cheapest they’ve been in 3 years. But Bermuda takes the cake with our lowest average airfare of $542.*
Send yourself south
 
•
Tip 2: Go price-peeping. 
Got a tight budget? Keep to it with Explore. Just tell us how much you’re willing to spend and we’ll show you where in the world to fly.
Map it out
 
•
Tip 3: Stick to June (or September). 
The sooner - or later - in summer you set your dates, the less you’ll pay. (PS don’t forget to create a Price Alert for your flight.)
Time it right

Professionals Learning
Mitigating ICE Raid Risks in 2025: Key Compliance Strategies for Businesses
Live Webinar | 1 CEU | SHRM and HRCI Approved
Date: April 18, 2025 | Time: 10 AM PT | 01 PM ET | Duration: 60 Minutes
Register Now
 
Webinar Details:
This webinar offers a chance for our organization to deepen our understanding of immigration enforcement and ensure we are fully equipped to navigate this complex landscape. It will provide critical training regarding our rights and responsibilities in the context of ICE raids, enabling us to minimize risks and ensure operational stability.
Racquel Harris,
 this session will cover the definition and purpose of ICE, as well as the potential impacts of ICE raids on businesses and employees. Racquel will also provide valuable insights into creating an effective ICE raid Response Plan, an essential strategy for maintaining legal compliance and protecting our operations and workforce.
Session Highlights:
The Definition and Purpose of ICE (Immigration and Customs Enforcement).
How ICE raids can impact businesses and employees.
Potential consequences of non-compliance with immigration laws.
Proactive Compliance Strategies.
Understanding the legal and financial consequences of violations.
Protecting employees, business operations, and legal reputation.

MIDNIGHT 
OIL
EDITION 298
RESOURCES & TIPS
 
Grants vs. loans - what's the difference?
It's no secret that businesses need funds to start, run, and grow, but which option makes the most sense for your business, specifically when comparing grants and loans? 
Explore the unique features 
of both funding sources to see if they align with your goals and objectives.
  
Tax record retention: a quick guide
Tax season is almost over — but before you celebrate by shredding every piece of paper related to your taxes, hold on! This guide will 
break down IRS records
 retention requirements, clarifying how long you should store tax returns, statements, and supporting documents to avoid future headaches and hefty penalties.
  
Level up with gamification
Want to build a thriving brand community that's buzzing with engagement? Gamification incorporates game-like elements like points, badges, and leaderboards into your customer interactions that can spark excitement and encourage more participation from your business’s community. 
Here's how to give it a try
. 
  
CO— EVENTS
  
 
APRIL 3 | ONLINE
The Power of Failure in Building Business Success   
Tune in 
this Thursday, April 3
 at noon ET to hear how Brian Scudamore, the entrepreneur and founder of 1-800-GOT-JUNK?, built a massive empire by embracing what he calls the "WTF" – "Willing to Fail" – philosophy that transforms failure into a positive force.
REGISTER NOW
 
  
  
  
 
MAY 1 | IN PERSON & ONLINE
CO— 
Small Business Day 2025
Celebrate Small Business Day with CO—! Join us online or in person on 
Thursday, May 1
 for a day of deep learning, networking, and actionable business tips. Hear from business experts and entrepreneurs as they share all the keys you need to scale operations and accelerate growth.
REGISTER NOW
 
  
QUOTABLE MOMENT
“Change fatigue leads to disengagement, turnover, and poor performance. Fix it by right-sizing expectations, aligning strategy with implementation, and ensuring people have what they need to succeed.”
— Lauren Buckley, Strategy Principal and Founder of The Hush Collaborative, 
shares insights to help entrepreneurs prevent and avoid the overwhelming, exhausting feeling of change fatigue
.
A MESSAGE FROM WALMART BUSINESS
 
Tax-Exempt Shopping Made Easy
Imagine a world where managing your organization's budget is easier, faster, and more transparent. With Walmart Business and the WTEP, that vision becomes a reality. Walmart Business offers a streamlined solution that simplifies tax-exempt purchasing, both online and in-store, saving you time and money. 
‌
Enjoy simple tax-exempt shopping with Walmart Business – easily apply your status in-store or online with Walmart Pay in the Walmart Business app.
‌
Eligible organizations, terms apply.
LEARN MORE
 
  
BY THE NUMBERS
  
63%
Studies show that customers are more likely to buy from a local chamber of commerce member business. By joining your local chamber of commerce, you can 
take advantage of this benefit
 and many others. 
  
7
Want to level up your public speaking game? Studying the traits of successful orators is a great place to start. Here, we break down 
seven must-have characteristics
 that can help you transform from a nervous to noteworthy public speaker.
  
99%
Implementing MFA can significantly reduce the likelihood of your business being hacked. 
Discover why
 all small businesses should consider evaluating their cyber insurance needs, from data protection to financial security.
  
GRANTS & AWARDS
The 
Entreprenista Evolve Grant
 offers $2,500 in funding to support one woman founder in growing and scaling her business. Open to all entrepreneurs who identify as women, this grant aims to help close funding gaps and provide meaningful momentum through both financial support and community connection. Applications must be submitted by
 April 5
.
‌
The 
Rémy Martin This is My City Microgrant
 is awarding $20,000 grants along with one-on-one mentorship from industry experts to emerging creatives who contribute to their local culture through entrepreneurial projects. Chosen candidates will be recognized as honorees and receive guidance from established figures in music, art, or culture. Eligible applicants must be at least 21 years old and reside in one of the four cities: Atlanta, Chicago, Detroit, or New York City. Applications are due by 
April 11
.
‌
The 
Walmart Spark Good Local Grants
 program, provided by Walmart and Sam’s Club, offers grants ranging from $250 to $5,000 for organizations that address the unique needs of local communities. Tax ID status determines eligibility, with 501(c)(3) charities, public entities, and educational institutions qualifying. Grant applications are accepted quarterly, with the current round open through 
April 15
.
‌
The 
Famous Amos Ingredients for Success Entrepreneurs Initiative
 awards $50,000 to three Black-owned startup businesses in the U.S. In partnership with the U.S. Black Chambers, Inc., this annual program supports Black entrepreneurs with capital, valuable resources, and access to a strong professional network. Applications must include a pitch video and business overview and are open through 
April 23
.
‌
Skip is offering its 
$10,000 Small Business Grants
 to entrepreneurs across the U.S. to provide financial support for small businesses. With a limited number of applications accepted, qualified applicants have a greater chance of receiving funding. Applications are due by 
April 25
‌
The 
Santander X Cultivate Small Business program
 offers a $20,000 grant and training program designed to support early-stage food entrepreneurs in the northeast and beyond. Applications for the Fall cohort, serving businesses in Rhode Island, Connecticut, Massachusetts, and the Greater Philadelphia, New York City, and Miami areas, are open through 
July 8
.
‌
More grant & program information can be found 
here
.

subject: SaaS Growth System Overview 🚀
body:
SaaS Growth System Overview 🚀
Briza--
Our primary marketing strategy for 
SaasRise
 and 
GrowthRise
 is to send out really useful growth and scaling content. So here we go...
Every Wednesday for the next 28 weeks, I'll be sending you our SaaS Growth Course videos and slides to support you in scaling to $50M+ in ARR.
Feel free to forward these on to other team members as desired. The full version of this course is available immediately to our members within the SaasRise and GrowthRise community platforms.
» 
View the SaaS Growth System Lesson Slides (Over 1480 slides)
This course is designed to be applicable to anyone building a B2B SaaS company who is selling into the SMB, Midmarket, or Enterprise.
This is just a sampler for our upcoming live 16 week 
Done-With-You B2B SaaS Growth Program
. where each week the program is delivered live with the goal of implementing ABM Lead List Building, AI-personalized outbound, and digital ads into your SaaS firm.
While many of the lessons will be applicable to a B2C SaaS company (the sections on affiliates, ads, and organic), the course is designed primarily for B2B SaaS where the annual contract value is $500 or above. The strategy works particularly well when the ACV is $1k to $200k.
We'll see you next time with more SaaS growth and scaling content.
In the meantime, check out our upcoming
 live 16 week 
Done-With-You B2B SaaS Growth Program
, designed to be the best program for scaling B2B SaaS firms from $1M to $100M in ARR by building a predictable revenue machine and combining ABM lead list building with AI personalized outbound with scalable digital advertising. Be sure to apply by April 30.
All the best,
Ryan
Ryan Allis, CEO & Founder
SaasRise - The Community for SaaS CEOs & Founders
www.saasrise.com
 |  Austin, TX
P.S. - Be sure check out 
GrowthRise
,
 our new mastermind community for B2B Marketing & Sales Leaders at 
www.growthrise.com
 where we teach how to rapidly scale up revenue within a B2B firm. Send your Head of Marketing, Growth, or Sales to join us and we'll take good care of them!
 
 
About the Author:
Ryan Allis is the CEO and co-founder of 
SaasRise
, the community for SaaS CEOs & founders, and 
GrowthRise
, the comunity for B2B Marketing & Sales Leaders. Ryan founded and grew iContact as CEO to $50M ARR, sold it for $169M, and earned his MBA from Harvard Business School. Today, Ryan coaches SaaS CEOs in rapidly scaling up revenue, building their teams, and achieving $100M+ exits. He's coached the CEOs of high growth B2B SaaS firms like Instantly, Clearstream, Seamless, Tatango, and many others. You can 
join SaasRise here
 and 
join GrowthRise here
.

CharterUP was chosen to deliver it's seamless, technology-driven shuttle experience at Miami International Airport. Our passenger-first approach ensures efficient, scalable transportation for events, shuttle programs, and transit solutions.
From high-volume airport shuttles to large-scale events and daily shuttles, our innovative technology keeps people moving with:
Real-Time Tracking & Dynamic Scheduling 
Live GPS tracking and AI-powered scheduling optimize fleet performance and minimize wait times.
Seamless Passenger Experience
Contactless payments, automated passenger counting, and real-time alerts.
Scalable & Flexible Solutions 
Adapts to fluctuating passenger volumes and traffic patterns.
The same cutting-edge technology powering MIA’s shuttle program also transforms event transportation for conferences, festivals, and sporting events nationwide. 
Let’s connect to explore how CharterUP can optimize transportation for your next event.

2025 Audience Survey
Three reasons to take our audience survey
Hey there, business owners, entrepreneurs, and decision-makers! We're reaching out one last time to invite you to participate in our annual reader survey. Why? 
Because your voice matters!
Take the Survey
 
  
  
  
Influence Our Content
Your feedback helps us tailor our articles, guides, and resources to address your specific challenges and interests. 
‌
Share your stories
Our U.S. Chamber of Commerce colleagues are interested in hearing stories related to recent policy initiatives — including trade and tax policies — directly from you.
‌
Help Build a Better CO—
By sharing your experiences, you're contributing to a stronger, more relevant resource for the entire business community. 
  
Give us five minutes and we’ll give you the chance to tell us what your business needs. Plus, as a thank you for your time and valuable insights, you'll be entered to win one of 
three $100 Amazon gift cards
! Be sure to submit your entry before the survey closes this Thursday, April 3.

click here
.

subject: Our Latest Spring Updates
body:
From our 2025 Gala to key industry insights—catch up with us!
 
 
Hello, Creative Spirit Connect Community 
﻿Happy Spring! We have some exciting updates to kick off the season. 
First is our annual gala, which will be held on 
April 21, 2025, at 6 p.m.
in the Board Room at the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE)
. 
We’ll be honoring our 2025 Corporate Champions of Neurodiversity: 
Donna Murphy, Global CEO of Havas Health & Creative Networks
, and 
Raja Rajamannar, the Chief Marketing & Communications Officer at Mastercard
. 
We have set a brilliant goal: To empower neurodivergent individuals by creating one million fair-wage integrated opportunities by 2030—paving the road to financial independence. 
Get Your Tickets at 
HireDifferent25.givesmart.com
. 
 
Donate To Our Mission.
 
 
 
 
 
We’re excited to announce a new partnership with Havas 
Neuroverse: Powered by Havas
,
 a groundbreaking consultancy that integrates neurodivergent talent into creative, marketing, strategy, and business transformation, driving innovation and fresh perspectives. With 53% of Gen Z identifying as neurodivergent, and 1 in 5 people identifying as neurodivergent overall, inclusive hiring is the right thing to do, and it’s smart business as well. 
Read The Full Story
 
Stay Informed With Our In-Depth, Original Content
We continue to cover some of the most important disability/neurodiversity rights issues, including challenges to Social Security, Medicare, and legislation like Section 504, which has protected the rights of people with disabilities (PWD) for decades. 
Rather than being deterred by these obstacles, we see critical opportunities to share the importance of defending disability rights and ensuring fair-wage employment for the neurodiverse community. 
﻿Times like these make us eternally grateful for supporters like you who enable Creative Spirit’s mission. Working together, there’s truly no limit to what we can accomplish.

by Menachem Rephun

At Creative Spirit, we recognize that hiring neurodivergent talent goes beyond inclusion: it unlocks a competitive advantage.
 
Here’s how we can help your organization harness this incredible potential.
Tailored Consulting and Training:
 
We provide expert guidance to help you build a workplace where neurodivergent talent can excel. Our training for teams and hiring managers focuses on best practices for successfully integrating neurodivergent employees.
 
Skill-Based Job Matching:
 
Our specialized job-matching process connects you with candidates whose unique skills align with your business needs, paving the way for mutual success.
 
Employee Resource Group (ERG) Activation:
 
We assist in developing or expanding ERG's focused on neurodiversity, fostering a supportive culture that empowers neurodivergent employees and builds community.
 
Ongoing Mentorship and Coaching:
 
Our coaching services offer neurodivergent employees the guidance they need to flourish while we mentor managers in creating supportive and stigma-free work environments.
 
Expertise Across Industries:
 
Whether in media, PR, technology, or beyond, our industry experts help you refine hiring processes and create work environments that uplift neurodivergent talent. 
Whether you’re looking to enhance hiring practices or implement training/mentorship programs, we’re here to support you every step of the way.
 
Contact Creative Spirit so we can help you start hiring employees who are neurodivergent. Whether you’re looking to enhance hiring practices or implement training and mentorship programs, we’re here to support you every step of the way.
For Neurodiverse Individuals: How We Can Support You.
 
Since 2017, Creative Spirit has connected neurodivergent professionals with top companies, achieving a 95% retention rate through personalized coaching, mentorship, and job placement. We partner directly with organizations and candidates to drive meaningful career growth—because diverse workplaces are stronger and more innovative.

subject: Get Ready to Play: International Fun at Work Day is Here! — Let’s Roam
body:
Hello Briza,
Ready to shake up your workday? In honor of International Fun at Work Day, we’re diving into a world where productivity meets play. Today, we celebrate creativity, connection, and the simple joys that make our work environment truly special. 
Office Playground: Turning Work into Play 🎲
Transform your workspace into a dynamic playground of innovation with 
Let’s Roam’s virtual office games
 and 
epic coworker feud challenges
! Enjoy mini-games during breaks, engaging team challenges, and playful brainstorming sessions that spark creativity and boost morale. 
Let’s Roam: New Read Alert 📚️
Explore 
The Power of Fun by Catherine Price
, a book that unpacks how fun is not just leisure but a catalyst for creativity and productivity. Learn actionable strategies such as setting aside dedicated "fun time", engaging in playful challenges, and cultivating a work culture where humor and joy are celebrated. 
Picture a spontaneous dance break—
what's your go-to dance move to spark fun and energy in the office, and why?
 Share your ideas and inspire your colleagues! Let your imagination run wild with the team. 
Start a fun conversation! 🎉 Copy and paste this into your team chat: 
 
Here at Let's Roam, we believe even a brief dance move can transform your day. Imagine taking a few moments to let loose—perhaps with a playful shimmy, a smooth slide, or an energetic spin. Now it’s your turn: 
What’s your go-to dance move to spark fun and energy in the office, and why?
 
Let’s Roam: Did You Know?🤔
Did you know that playful moments at work can lead to more creative problem solving? Research suggests that a lighthearted environment encourages risk-taking and creative brainstorming, turning even the toughest challenges into opportunities for innovation.
Virtual Joy: Bringing Play to Remote Work 🖥️
Transform remote work into a dynamic arena for fun. From 
virtual scavenger hunts
 to costume-themed meetings, explore engaging activities that boost team morale and spark creative connections, no matter where you are.
Playful Wrap-Up: Keep the Fun Alive! 🎉
As we wrap up our celebration of International Fun at Work Day, remember: 
fun isn’t just a one-day event 
—it’s a way to spark creativity and build lasting connections. Carry this playful energy with you and keep the laughter alive in every project. Share your epic party challenge ideas and let’s make every day a celebration! 
Keep the fun rolling,
 
Let’s Roam 
JOIN THE FUN!
 
Let's Roam, LLC, 4023 Kennett Pike, #50241, Wilmington, DE 19807, United States, 1-(833)-202-ROAM (7626)

subject: Stop I-9 Catastrophes Before They Start. Don’t Miss April 2.
body:
What you don’t know could cost you hefty fines. Get I-9 compliance right with SHRM. 
 
 
The stakes have never been higher for employers navigating Form I-9 compliance, immigration law, and regulations. Are you confident your organization is fully prepared? 
I-9 compliance isn’t optional. Failing to follow the immigration employment verification requirements can result in significant fines, criminal sanctions, legal exposure, and reputational damage. With recent executive orders amplifying immigration enforcement efforts, your organization must understand the latest critical updates to stay protected, up-to-date and compliant. Secure your spot for the exclusive webinar, 
I-9 Land Mines: What You Don’t Know Will Cost You
, on 
Wednesday, April 2, from 1 p.m. to 2 p.m. ET
. 
Join SHRM’s CHRO and a legal expert as they break down the latest I-9 compliance updates and share actionable strategies to safeguard your workforce and your operations.
In this webinar, you’ll gain: 
Knowledge of changing regulations and avoid costly missteps.
An understanding of the most frequent I-9 errors and how to correct them. 
Actionable steps to protect your organization and minimize risk.
Strategies to streamline I-9 processes and improve compliance.
Failure to act could cost you far more than just penalties. Stay informed, stay compliant, and take the necessary steps to protect what matters most. 
Plus, be the first to get an exclusive preview of SHRM’s new I-9 toolkit on April 2. Once released, you can purchase for $395 or 
join SHRM
 for $299 to access the toolkit and everything else SHRM has to offer — expert resources, the HR Crisis Hotline, legal updates, and more. 
 
 
 
REGISTER NOW
 
 
Presenting Experts
 
 
 
 
Daniel Brown
Daniel Brown is a partner at Fragomen’s Washington, D.C., office, and is part of the firm’s Government Strategies and Compliance Group. His experience includes counseling corporate clients on business immigration, compliance, and enforcement matters, with a focus on I-9 and E-Verify issues. 
 
 
 
 
Jim Link, SHRM-SCP
Jim Link is the CHRO for SHRM. As a sought-after speaker on the international stage, his insightful presentations delve into critical aspects of the contemporary workplace, including but not limited to inclusion, employee experience and engagement organizational culture, benefits strategies, and mental health advocacy.

Collection Spotlight
Allow Us to Introduce 
Red Mountain Resort 
With a blend of flexible indoor spaces and breathtaking outdoor venues, Red Mountain Resort provides the perfect backdrop for meetings, corporate retreats, and unparalleled team-building experiences. Our flexible meeting spaces, including the spacious Padre Canyon Conference Room and the intimate Painted Desert Room, are designed to inspire productivity while seamlessly integrating nature and comfort. Attendees can take advantage of modern meeting facilities and customized catering options featuring fresh, nourishing cuisine.
To elevate team-building and relaxation, we offer a variety of immersive experiences that embrace the stunning red rock landscape. Groups can embark on guided hikes through the majestic trails of Snow Canyon State Park, participate in rejuvenating yoga and meditation sessions, or explore the desert terrain on scenic bike excursions - all designed to foster connection, creativity, and well-being.
REACH OUT FOR AVAILABLE DATES
 
Canyon Breeze: A Fresh Take on Flavor
Canyon Breeze Restaurant offers a vibrant and wholesome dining experience, where fresh, seasonal ingredients shine in every dish. Begin your meal with a refreshing Blue Field Green Salad or the savory Crispy Brussel Sprouts. Savor thoughtfully crafted entrées like the King Salmon, the hearty Quinoa Vegetable Burger, or the Steak Frites each prepared with a focus on wellness and taste. Pair your meal with a carefully selected wine, creating a dining experience that is as nourishing as it is delicious.
Elevate Corporate Wellness at Sagestone Spa & Salon
Sagestone Spa & Salon offers a rejuvenating retreat where wellness and relaxation harmonize, creating the perfect balance for corporate groups seeking restoration and renewal. Meeting planners can elevate their team’s experience with customized spa parties, including soothing Desert Stone Massages and invigorating Red Earth Facials, each designed to reduce stress and enhance well-being. If you are looking for a midday refresh or a post-meeting unwind, Sagestone Spa provides a restorative complement to any corporate retreat, fostering relaxation, focus, and team connection in an inspiring desert setting.

Regional Cuisine Spotlights: Incorporating Local Flavors into Your Event
 
Integrating regional cuisine into your meeting or event can create a unique and memorable experience for attendees. Local flavors add an authentic touch, connecting guests to the culture and history of the destination while elevating the overall dining experience. When planning your menu, consider working with local chefs or coordinate with our catering teams who specialize in regional dishes and seasonal ingredients. If it’s fresh seafood from coastal areas, hearty barbecue in the South, or farm-to-table specialties in rural regions, highlighting local flavors allows attendees to experience the essence of the location in a meaningful way.
 
Beyond traditional meal service, there are many creative ways to incorporate local cuisine into your event. Interactive food stations, chef-led tastings, or cooking demonstrations can engage guests and offer a deeper appreciation of the area’s culinary traditions. Consider incorporating regional beverages, such as local wines, craft beers, or specialty cocktails, to further enhance the theme. Even small touches, like sourcing pastries from a well-loved neighborhood bakery or featuring a signature dish from the region, can make a lasting impression. By thoughtfully incorporating local flavors, you create a dining experience that not only satisfies but also tells a story - making your event all the more engaging and memorable.

1. Earn 130,000 Hilton Honors Bonus Points and One Free Night Reward
You can earn 130,000 Hilton Honors Bonus Points and one Free Night Reward from Hilton Honors after you spend $3,000 (the "Threshold Amount") on eligible purchases on your Card in your first 6 months of Card Membership starting from the date that your account is opened. Eligible purchases include those made by both the Basic and Additional Card Members on the Card Account. Eligible purchases are purchases for goods and services minus returns and other credits. Eligible purchases do NOT include fees or interest charges, cash advances, purchase of traveler’s checks, purchase or reloading of prepaid cards, purchases of gift cards, person-to-person payments, or other cash equivalents. Additional Card Members on your account are not eligible for this offer. To receive Bonus Points, your Card account must not be cancelled or past due at the time of fulfillment. Hilton Honors Bonus Points will be credited to your Hilton Honors account 8-12 weeks after the Threshold Amount has been reached. Bonus Points do not count toward elite tier qualification; for more information, visit 
HiltonHonors.com/terms
.
The Free Night Reward will be issued in the form of a redeemable code and sent in an email from Hilton Honors to the email address listed on your Hilton Honors account up to 16 weeks after the Threshold Amount has been reached. Eligible purchases do NOT include fees or interest charges, cash advances, purchase of traveler's checks, purchase or reloading of prepaid cards, purchases of gift cards, person-to-person payments, or other cash equivalents. Eligible purchases are purchases for goods and services minus returns and other credits. To receive the Hilton Honors Free Night Reward, your Card Account must not be cancelled or past due at the time of fulfillment. The Free Night Reward can be redeemed any night of the week for a one night standard accommodation, double occupancy, subject to availability at properties in the Hilton portfolio, excluding those listed at 
HiltonHonors.com/freenightreward
. To redeem the Free Night Reward, you must call 1-800-446-6677. Free Night Rewards will expire 12 months from date of issuance. The Free Night Reward will be forfeited if not redeemed for a stay on or before the expiration date. To ensure receipt of the reward e-mail notification, you should confirm the correct email address is listed on your Hilton Honors account profile. You can also check your Hilton Honors account for the status of a Free Night Reward issued to you (including the expiration date) by calling 1-800-446-6677. The Free Night Reward is not transferable and may not be redeemed for cash or Hilton Honors Points. The Free Night Reward may be combined with other Hilton or Free Night promotions in market and may be added to existing paid or Reward stays. The Free Night Reward includes all applicable resort fees and taxes on the cost of the room for the redeemed night. The Card Member is responsible for all incidental charges. The Free Night Reward may be subject to additional policies from Hilton Honors; for more information, visit 
https://www.Hilton.com/en/p/promotions/free-night-terms/
.
If you have a history of canceling or downgrading American Express Card accounts within your first year and you cancel or downgrade your new Card account within your first year, we may not credit, we may freeze, or we may take away the Hilton Honors Bonus Points and one Free Night Reward from your account. If we determine that you have engaged in abuse, misuse, or gaming in connection with this offer in any way or that you intend to do so, including if you return purchases you made to meet the Threshold Amount, we may not credit, we may freeze, or we may take away the Hilton Honors Bonus Points and one Free Night Reward from your account. We may also cancel any accounts you have with us.
This offer is not transferable. If your application is not received by 4/29/2025, we will not process your application even if we later receive your application. American Express reserves the right to modify or revoke offer at any time.
2. Hilton Honors Bonus Points on Eligible Purchases
Hilton Honors Bonus Points earned using your Hilton Honors American Express Surpass® Card: 
You will receive 3 Hilton Honors Bonus Points for each dollar of eligible purchases.
You will receive 9 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points, for a total of 12, for each dollar of eligible purchases charged directly with a property within the Hilton portfolio, including bookings and incidental charges. To receive the 9 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points for charges made at the time of booking, the booking must be made directly through a reservation channel operated by Hilton. You can receive the 9 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points for incidental charges made at the hotel (including charges made at restaurants, spas, and other establishments) if those charges can be and are charged to your room and paid for with your Hilton Honors American Express Surpass® Card at checkout.
You will receive 3 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points, for a total of 6, for each dollar of eligible purchases at the following categories of merchants excluding superstores and warehouse clubs: restaurants located in the U.S., supermarkets located in the U.S. and on gasoline at gas stations located in the U.S.
To get additional Points for a restaurant purchase, the purchase must be at a restaurant located in the United States. You will NOT get additional Points for purchases made at a restaurant owned by a U.S. company but located outside the U.S. (e.g. Hard Rock Café in Paris). You also will NOT get additional Points for restaurant purchases at nightclubs, convenience stores, grocery stores, or supermarkets. You may not get additional Points for purchases at a restaurant located within another establishment (e.g. a restaurant inside a hotel, casino, or event venue). For example, purchases made at a restaurant located within a hotel may be recognized as a purchase at a hotel, not a restaurant.
You will receive 1 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Point, for a total of 4, for each dollar of eligible online retail purchases made on a website or a digital application (an app) from a U.S. retail merchant that sells physical goods or merchandise directly to consumers. To identify eligible online retail purchases, we rely on information provided to us by the merchant. The following are not considered retail purchases: purchases made at restaurants, supermarkets, gasoline stations, or automotive dealers, as well as purchases of travel, entertainment, or other services. Payment must be made online and categorized as an internet transaction by the merchant for the purchase to be eligible. You will not receive additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points for purchases made online but paid for in store. Payments made in store using a mobile or digital wallet or a contactless payment device are not considered online purchases. You will not receive additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points for purchases made by phone or mail, or by using a third party "buy now pay later" installment program.  
Your Hilton Honors Points are subject to Hilton Honors Terms and Conditions; see 
HiltonHonors.com/terms
. 
Eligible purchases are purchases for goods and services minus returns and other credits. Eligible purchases do NOT include fees or interest charges, cash advances, purchases of travelers checks, purchases or reloading of prepaid cards, purchases of gift cards, person-to-person payments, or purchases of other cash equivalents. Hilton Honors Bonus Points you earn with your Card will be posted to your Hilton Honors account up to 12 weeks after the end of your billing period.
Purchases made through a third-party payment account or on an online marketplace (with multiple retailers) will not receive additional points.
Merchants are assigned codes based on what they primarily sell. We group certain merchant codes into categories that are eligible for additional Points. A purchase with a merchant will not receive additional Points if the merchant’s code is not included in a reward category. You may not receive additional Points if we receive inaccurate information or are otherwise unable to identify your purchase as eligible for a reward category. For example, you may not receive additional Points when: a merchant uses a third-party to sell their products or services; or a merchant uses a third-party to process or submit your transaction to us (e.g., using mobile or wireless card readers); or you choose to make a purchase using a third-party payment account or make a purchase using a mobile or digital wallet.
Please visit 
americanexpress.com/rewards-info
 for more information about rewards.
 
3. Hilton Honors Complimentary Gold Status
You will receive complimentary Hilton Honors Gold status with your Hilton Honors American Express Surpass® Card. Please allow up to 12 weeks from account open date for your complimentary Gold status to be applied to your Hilton Honors account. Complimentary Gold status benefit is only available to the Basic Card Member. If your Hilton Honors American Express Surpass® Card is cancelled for any reason, your complimentary Hilton Honors Gold status provided with the Card will be cancelled. American Express reserves the right to change, modify or revoke complimentary Gold status at any time. If your complimentary Gold status is cancelled, you may be able to maintain your Gold status by qualifying under the Hilton Honors Program terms. Gold status benefits are subject to availability and vary by hotel. For more information on Gold status benefits or how to maintain Gold status each year with qualifying stays, nights or Hilton Honors Base Points through the Hilton Honors Program, visit 
HiltonHonors.com/MemberBenefits
, 
Hilton.com/en/Hilton-Honors/benefit-terms/
, 
HiltonHonors.com/SLHTerms
, and 
HiltonHonors.com/AutoCampTerms
. The Hilton Honors Program, including the benefits of Hilton Honors Membership, are subject to Hilton Honors Terms and Conditions; see 
HiltonHonors.com/terms
.
4. Hilton Honors Free Night Reward
Basic Card Members can receive a Free Night Reward from Hilton Honors after the total eligible purchases on their Hilton Honors American Express Surpass® Card account reach $15,000 in a calendar year. The Free Night Reward will be issued in the form of a redeemable code and sent to the Basic Card Member in an email from Hilton Honors to the email address listed on their Hilton Honors account. The Basic Card Member will receive the Reward email within 8-12 weeks after meeting the purchase requirement. This benefit is only available to the Basic Card Member; however, eligible purchases made by Additional Card Members will contribute to the purchase requirement.
Eligible purchases to meet the purchase requirement are for goods and services minus returns and other credits. Eligible purchases do NOT include fees or interest charges, cash advances, purchases of travelers checks, purchases or reloading of prepaid cards, purchases of gift cards, person-to-person payments, or other cash equivalents. If you transfer to a different Hilton Honors American Express Card that has a Free Night Reward benefit, any eligible purchases you made on your old Card Account will count toward the new Card Account’s Free Night Reward purchase requirement, after your first transaction on the new Card Account.
The Free Night Reward can be redeemed for one standard accommodation, double occupancy, subject to availability, at properties in the Hilton portfolio, excluding those listed at 
HiltonHonors.com/freenightreward
. 
To redeem the Free Night Reward, Basic Card Members must call 1-800-446-6677 and mention the code provided by Hilton Honors. A Free Night Reward expires one year from the date of issuance and must be redeemed on or before the expiration date. A Free Night Reward will be forfeited if not redeemed on or before the expiration date.
To ensure receipt of the Free Night Reward e-mail notification, confirm the correct email address is listed on your Hilton Honors account profile. To view the status of any Free Night Rewards issued to you, visit your Hilton Honors Account Dashboard at 
HiltonHonors.com
. 
The Free Night Reward is not transferable and may not be redeemed for cash or Hilton Honors Points. A Free Night Reward may be combined with other Hilton or Free Night promotions in market and may be added to existing paid or Reward stays. A Free Night Reward includes all applicable resort fees and taxes on the cost of the room for the redeemed night at all locations except for a tourism tax at properties located in Malaysia. The Card Member is responsible for all incidental charges and, if applicable, the Malaysian tourism tax. Free Night Reward redemptions may be cancelled pursuant to the Free Night Reward cancellation policy on the Hilton Honors Program website (
HiltonHonors.com
). 
Free Night Rewards are subject to Hilton Terms and Conditions, available at 
https://www.hilton.com/en/p/promotions/free-night-terms/
.
5. $200 Hilton Statement Credit
Basic Hilton Honors American Express Surpass Card Members can receive up to a total of $50 in statement credits each calendar quarter (January through March, April through June, July through September, and October through December), for up to $200 back annually, for eligible purchases charged directly with a property within the Hilton portfolio on their Card Account, including bookings and incidental charges. For a booking to be eligible for a statement credit, the booking must be made directly through a reservation channel operated by Hilton. Bookings or purchases made through a third party other than Hilton, such as an online travel website, will not be eligible for statement credit(s). At certain hotels, if your booking is part of a contract for an event, the purchase may not be eligible for a statement credit. For an incidental charge (including charges made at restaurants, spas, and other establishments within the hotel property) to be eligible for a statement credit, the incidental charge must be charged to your room and paid for with your Hilton Honors American Express Surpass Card at checkout.
Eligible purchases can be made by both the Basic and any Additional Card Members on the Card Account. However, the total amount of statement credits for eligible purchases will not exceed $200 per Card Account per calendar year. Please allow 8-12 weeks after the eligible purchase is charged to your Card Account for statement credit(s) to be posted to the Account. Please call American Express at the number on the back of your Card if statement credits have not posted after 12 weeks from the date of purchase. To receive this benefit, your Card account must not be cancelled or past due at the time of statement credit fulfillment. Statement credit(s) may not be received or may be reversed if the purchase is cancelled or modified, or if you engage in abuse or misuse in connection with the benefit.
American Express relies on the merchant’s processing of transactions to determine the transaction date. The transaction date may differ from the date you made the purchase if, for example, there is a delay in the merchant submitting the transaction to us or if the merchant uses another date as the transaction date. This means that in some cases your purchase may not earn the statement credit benefit for the benefit period in which you made the purchase. For example, if an eligible purchase is made on December 31st but the merchant processes the transaction such that it is identified to us as occurring on January 1st, the January statement credit would be applied. American Express also relies on information provided to us by the merchant to identify eligible purchases. If American Express does not receive information that identifies your transaction as eligible for this benefit, the Basic Card Member will not receive the statement credit. For example, your purchase will not be eligible if it is not made directly with Hilton (e.g., if a purchase is made at a restaurant or convenience store within a Hilton property). Basic Card Members may not receive the statement credit if we receive inaccurate information or are otherwise unable to identify your purchase as eligible, if a transaction is made with an electronic wallet or through a third party (such as an app store), or if the merchant uses a mobile or wireless card reader to process it.
Please do not reply to this email, as mail sent to this address cannot be answered.
 If you have questions please visit our 
Customer Support
 page and select the applicable contact method.
Hilton Honors™ membership and redemption of Points are subject to 
Hilton Honors Terms and Conditions
.

. Click here to

contacting by phone
 or 
chatting with us
. You can also visit our 
support center
 for additional questions.

subject: Will you be joining us on April 21 to impact Neurodiversity and Celebrate Innovators?
body:
Help us reach our goal—one million fair-wage opportunities for neurodivergent professionals by 2030.
 
 
 
Join Us on April 21, 2025, at 6 pm 
at the Board Room of The New York Stock Exchange 
 
Dear Friends and Supporters of Creative Spirit,
We’re excited to remind you about our annual gala at the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) on April 21, 2025. This year’s theme, 
Illuminating Brilliance
, reflects our bold vision: empowering neurodivergent professionals by creating one million fair-wage integrated opportunities by 2030—paving the way to financial independence and workplace inclusion.
 
Honoring Our 2025 Corporate Champions of Neurodiversity
 
Donna Murphy 
Global
 
CEO, Havas Creative & Health Networks
 
Raja Rajamannar 
Chief Marketing & Communications Officer, Mastercard
 
We are proud to honor two exceptional leaders whose work has significantly advanced neurodiversity in the workplace: 
Donna Murphy, Global CEO of Havas Creative & Health Networks, and Raja Rajamannar, Chief Marketing & Communications Officer at Mastercard. 
At Havas, 
Donna has led the way in fostering inclusion, most notably through the launch of 
Neuroverse: Powered by Havas
—a groundbreaking Neurodiversity Center of Excellence focused on embedding neurodivergent talent at the core of creative marketing, brand strategy, and business transformation. 
At Mastercard, 
Raja is a staunch advocate and pioneer of new standards in accessible design, Raja’s commitment has led to such initiatives as the Touch Card feature, a series of unique notches for payment cards that help people who are low or partially sighted pay with touch alone. This work has earned Mastercard accolades from Disability:IN, Fast Company, Cannes Lions and other prestigious organizations. 
Why Attend? 
Be a Catalyst for Change
Join a community dedicated to making an immediate, meaningful impact on workplace inclusion. Connect with trailblazers shaping the future of neurodiversity in business.
Celebrate Candidate Success
Hear from neurodivergent professionals thriving in their careers and leaders championing inclusive workplaces. Learn firsthand how Creative Spirit is driving fundamental change in neurodiverse employment.
Support & Empower Neurodivergent Talent
Engage with companies committed to fostering diverse, inclusive work environments. Discover how we can work together to create more opportunities for neurodivergent professionals.
Learn more about Creative Spirit’s training, coaching, and employment services to see how your support makes a difference. 
We are deeply grateful for your generosity—and can’t wait to celebrate with you!
 
Buy Tickets, Donate, Sponsor
 
Sincerely,
Lori Falcone & Martha Riley
Creative Spirit Gala Co-Chairs
 
Sponsorship Details
 
Click here 
to buy tickets, donate, and sponsor.
CREATIVE SPIRIT USA INC | 
183 McLain Street
 | 
Bedford Corners, NY 10549 US

subject: How Executive Assistants can Manage Priorities with Confidence
body:
Owning Your Priorities: Leading with Clarity and Confidence
 
Live Webinar
: May 2, 2025, 12:00 pm EST | 60 minutes | $149
Executive Assistants often find themselves in a whirlwind of tasks, juggling multiple responsibilities while supporting high-level executives. This webinar will guide you through proven strategies to manage shifting priorities with intention and purpose. You'll learn how to move from feeling reactive to being proactive—transforming your approach to workload management and aligning your efforts with broader organizational goals.
Join this session to learn practical strategies that help you shift from reactive task management to proactive priority setting. Expert guidance will enable you to communicate your priorities confidently, align tasks with organizational objectives, and manage your workload with clarity.
Reserve Your Seat – $149 →
Your Benefits for Attending:
 
Identify tasks that directly contribute to business goals
Develop effective communication skills for discussing priorities with executives and teams
Implement proven methods to prioritize and structure your daily workflow
Reduce workplace stress through clearer priority setting
Create opportunities for strategic thinking within your daily tasks
By mastering these skills, you’ll be equipped to approach your role with greater confidence and effectiveness. Attendees will leave with actionable tools to prioritize tasks, communicate clearly, and manage their workload strategically to support executive goals and organizational success.
Discover How to Prioritize Your Workday →

subject: Honoree Highlight for Light the Darkness
body:
Join us in celebrating on May 29th!
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
 
 
Honoree Highlight: Institute for Nonviolence Chicago
 
Join us in honoring the Institute for Nonviolence Chicago, one of four honorees at our Light the Darkness gala on Thursday, May 29, 2025, at The Geraghty Chicago. Learn more about the 
Institute for Nonviolence Chicago
 and purchase your tickets to celebrate her 
here
.
The Institute for Nonviolence Chicago was founded in 2015 by Teny Gross, a lifelong peace activist who has built successful nonviolence models around the country. Their mission is to end the cycle of gun violence in Chicago.
Nonviolence Chicago is made up of over 100 street outreach workers, victim advocates, reentry specialists, behavioral health specialists, nonviolence trainers, case managers, and more. Nonviolence Chicago is a respected leader in gun violence prevention, intervention, and reduction. Their critical work heals and restores Chicago communities with the highest incidences of shootings. Their work has made a tremendous impact as part of Chicago’s public safety strategy because of their meaningful partnerships with community and research organizations, law enforcement, elected officials, and the business and philanthropic communities.
Guided by the nonviolence principles of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., they believe everyone has a part to play in ending gun violence. Their evidence-based model brings together civilians and organizations to implement wraparound services for high-risk individuals in Austin, West Garfield Park, Back of the Yards, and Brighton Park—bringing more peace, compassion, and hope to our streets and keeping Chicago safe for generations.
Receiving the award in honor of the Institute for Nonviolence Chicago is Founder and CEO, Teny Gross. Celebrate the Institute for Nonviolence Chicago with us—buy your tickets below.
Buy Now
 
If you or someone you know needs support, we're here to help. Call or text us at 833-NAMI-CHI (833-626-4244) or visit 
namichicago.org
.

Sorry to send you to the DMV. 
Sincerely. ↑ Starting May 7th, domestic travelers must carry REAL ID (or other acceptable identification). Here’s how to get yours - and what to know. 
Learn more 
 
Let’s break it down. 
•
What is REAL ID? 
REAL ID sets new security standards for driver’s licenses and other cards. (Psst: you’ll know an ID is compliant if it has a star up top. ⭐) 
•
How do I apply? 
You’ll have to visit the DMV (womp womp). Before making the trek, 
check your state’s requirements
 
to make sure you bring the right documents.
 
•
Do I still need a passport? 
Yes - if you plan on going abroad. But if you’re sticking to the States, you’ll only have to pack your REAL ID *or* passport (not both).

body:
+ A guide to turning failures into successes ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­  
 
MIDNIGHT 
OIL
EDITION 297
RESOURCES & TIPS
 
10+ tools to build your brand community
A loyal brand community can boost word-of-mouth marketing, provide invaluable insights, and ultimately help your business grow. 
Discover how these 10 tools
 can help you manage, moderate, and encourage a group of deeply devoted fans to connect around your business.
  
Tax tips: your daily accounting checklist
If the upcoming tax deadline keeps you up at night, it might be time to start utilizing a daily accounting checklist. 
Take these four steps
 to improve your year-round cash flow and save you from tax season jitters.
  
How to tap into your “local” network
From national chains to family-owned shops, every business has a local element. By tapping into that "local" ethos of care and support, you can build a thriving business. 
Check out our tips
 to find your niche and start exploring the possibilities right in your own backyard!
  
CO— EVENTS
 
Learn to embrace failure & grow your business
It's time to turn your setbacks into success. Join us 
on Thursday, April 3
 at noon ET to hear how Brian Scudamore, the founder of 1-800-GOT-JUNK?, built a massive empire by embracing what he calls the "WTF" – "Willing to Fail" – philosophy that transforms failure into a positive force. 
‌
He'll be offering practical strategies you can use right away to shift your perspective and leverage setbacks for growth. Register now and learn to turn junk into jewels from an entrepreneurial visionary!
Secure your Spot
 
  
QUOTABLE MOMENT
“Make sure your concept is really unique. Get objective feedback because it is a super competitive industry. The barrier to entry is low, but the barrier to building a customer base is tough. Have a team around you who tell you the hard truth.”
— Ron Robinson, Chemist and Founder/CEO of BeautyStat Cosmetics, 
offers advice for business owners looking to create major brands with minor budgets
.
CONTENT FROM THE U.S. CHAMBER
 
How to calculate your potential tax increase
If Congress fails to act, Main Street businesses nationwide are facing a potential wave of tax increases in the coming year. The expiration of key tax provisions, particularly the Section 199A deduction, could significantly impact the financial health of countless businesses. To help business owners understand the potential ramifications, the U.S. Chamber of Commerce has launched a new online tool: the 
QBI Tax Increase Calculator
.
‌
By leveraging the QBI Tax Increase Calculator, small businesses can better understand the impact of future tax policies for a more stable economic environment. Plus, 
share your story
 with USCC about how tax reform has helped your business and community.
Start Calculating
 
  
BY THE NUMBERS
  
3M
With millions of paid subscribers in 2024, Substack is quickly becoming a promising tool to help small businesses connect with their audiences. Still on the fence? 
Meet five small businesses
 leveraging the site to promote their brands.
  
#1
Recent research shows that affordable healthcare is the top benefit employees are looking for in a company. 
Click here to read more
 about purchasing healthcare for your small business.
  
50%
Did you know that nearly 50% of small business owners feel their company's HR structure is unprofessional? 
Here’s how outsourcing
 your human resource department can significantly improve team cohesion and productivity.
  
GRANTS & AWARDS
The 
Secretsos™ Small Business Grant
 offers $2,500 to help entrepreneurs overcome challenges and accelerate growth. Applications are due by 
March 31
, and the selected recipient will have full discretion on how to use the funds to support their business.
‌
Honeycomb Credit is offering a 
$10,000 Breakthrough Grant
 to support small businesses in achieving their next big milestone, such as opening a new location, launching a food truck, or franchising. Eligible applicants must own a small business; no purchase or payment is required to apply. Applications are due 
April 2
.
‌
The 
Pitch Perfect Grant
, a collaboration between Pink Print, Ellie Talks Money, and Skip, is offering a $5,000 grant to help entrepreneurs expand their businesses. This grant aims to support and scale businesses to reach important financial goals. Applicants must submit applications by
 April 5
.
‌
The 
Rémy Martin This is My City Microgrant
 is awarding $20,000 grants along with one-on-one mentorship from industry experts to emerging creatives who contribute to their local culture through entrepreneurial projects. Chosen candidates will be recognized as honorees and receive guidance from established figures in music, art, or culture. Applications are due by 
April 11
.
‌
More grant & program information can be found 
here
.

subject: Randall Stieghorst's LI Recommendation + Closing More Deals
body:
Hello Briza,

I saw Randall’s praise for your ability to handle diverse responsibilities at LCW—sounds like you thrive on challenges and keep everything seamlessly tied together. Really impressive!

BTW, if we could help you close more deals, would that be something you'd be open to?

Proshort's AI platform can analyze all your sales data and give your sales team actionable insights on exactly what to do to close more opportunities.

For example, we can help you get answers to questions like:

- What key factors influence decision-making for organizations seeking to improve DEI outcomes and optimize performance through culture-focused solutions?

- How does the cultural diversity of a target audience impact engagement strategies and closing success during sales conversations? 

It’s like ChatGPT, but for your sales data!

Open to seeing how it works?

Respectfully,
Lauren Mitchell
SDR
Proshort | Cupertino, CA
 

If you’re over it, reply “unsubscribe” and I’ll disappear quicker than a coworker at 4:59 PM on a Friday.

subject: Impressed by your background + Revenue Question
body:
Hi Briza,

Really impressed by how you support senior leaders and drive operational excellence at LCW. Your ability to foster internal cohesion seems invaluable—would love to hear more about your experience!

By the way, I noticed you’re the CEO of LCW.

Ratio specializes in helping organizations in the organizational development industry close more deals, minimize discounts, and get cash quicker by implementing our ‘Buy Now, Pay Later’ program for your customers.

It’s like Affirm and Klarna, but for B2B!

On average, our clients typically see a 35% increase in sales conversion and 25% increase in ACV.

Interested in seeing how it works?

Cheers,
Danielle White
Business Development
Ratio Tech | San Mateo, CA
 

Not useful? Reply ‘nope’ and we’ll ride off into the unsubscribe sunset.
